messages.messageBody:
"It's called Murray McMurray- http://www.mcmurrayhatchery.com/"

I have ordered chicks from them several times. There are two or three
other hatcheries but they don't have the selection Murry does.

messages.subject: Chickens
messages.msgSnippet: It s called Murray McMurray- http://www.mcmurrayhatchery.com/. That s where we usually got out chickens.  Even if you can t raise chickens where you live, the
messages.messageBody:
It's called Murray McMurray- http://www.mcmurrayhatchery.com/.
That's where we usually got out chickens. Even if you can't raise chickens where you live, the catalogue is really beautiful and worth getting.

Holly

--- In Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com, "Pam Hartley"
<pamhartley@m...> wrote:
> There's a hatchery that ships all kinds of eggs, I think they're
called
> McMurtry or something along those lines. Google.com will be your
friend in
> this pursuit. ;)
>
> Pam

messages.subject: Chickens
messages.msgSnippet: We too, have chickens just for fun.  I don t think I could kill them.  I have thought about maybe raising some broilers because it would be nice to have home
messages.messageBody:
We too, have chickens just for fun. I don't think I could kill them. I
have thought about maybe raising some broilers because it would be nice
to have home raised chicken. But, I'm not sure I could do it. We
probably will try though.
Yes, it is nice to have fresh eggs all the time, but they aren't free.
lol If you only knew what we have spent in fencing, time energy and
food for our chickens. lol. I do like them to have a nice life
though. I can't help it. I feel responsible for them.
Just my thoughts on my chickens.
A
